page.title: 18CESSNA FLIGHT FROM TEESSIDE
page.content: We tried to put our survey area into perspective by flying over a wider area of Teesside in a small, {4-seater Cessna plane. } The pilot was our art teacher. We were made temporary members of the Airport Flying Club before our flight could begin. Then, we walked towards the blue and white plane. The pilot checked that everything was secure. After getting the "okay" from the control tower, we moved slowly onto the runway. As we picked up speed, the plane was vibrating from head to tail. Suddenly, we were no longer on the ground, but tilted backwards and going upwards. Unfortunately, it was a very cloudy and windy day, so to avoid being bumped around too much, we went higher than the l,500 feet, which would have been best for seeing the land below.
